meanings.definition: to place or insert tills between other objects
meanings.sent1: She carefully intertills the colorful tills in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The farmer intertills the seeds into the soil for planting.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully intertill the building blocks in a row.
meanings.sent4: He intertills his ideas seamlessly into the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The artist intertills different shades to create a beautiful painting.

meanings.definition: the act of connecting or linking tills together
meanings.sent1: The intertills of the chains keep the swings connected.
meanings.sent2: The intertills of the train tracks ensure a smooth ride.
meanings.sent3: The intertills of the puzzle pieces make it challenging to solve.
meanings.sent4: The intertills of friendship bring people closer together.
meanings.sent5: The intertills of the story weave a captivating narrative.

meanings.definition: the space or area between tills
meanings.sent1: The intertills between the flower beds allow for easy maintenance.
meanings.sent2: The intertills in the fence provide a glimpse of the garden beyond.
meanings.sent3: The intertills on the shelf create a neat display of items.
meanings.sent4: The intertills of silence between the notes enhance the music.
meanings.sent5: The intertills of light and shadow create a beautiful pattern on the floor.
